Dear Anna,

> and a sample code from the post:

oup/junit/message/16237
> just won't compile because of the comma separatin=
g the two class names
> (Syntax error on token ",", / expected). 
> 
> What=
's the proper syntax, then?


The nice young man forgot his curly braces su=
rrounding the class list:
@SuiteClasses({ATest.class, BTest.class})

Making=
 the ATest and BTest classes public and placing them in separate
files shou=
ld also eliminate the following errors:

junit.framework.AssertionFailedErr=
or: Class ATest has no public
constructor 
java.lang.Exception: Test class =
should have public zero-argument
constructor


It works with me at least ;)=


Still, there's no sign of the syntax in Javadoc. Pity.
